alert.note: Alert for Dare (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 27 at 3:24AM EDT until June 27 at 6:00AM EDT by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 AM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN DARE COUNTY... At 324 AM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Avon to near Frisco, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Frisco, Avon, Buxton, Hatteras Ferry Terminal, Avon Pier and Cape Hatteras Lighthouse. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows. Please send your reports of hail and/or wind damage, including trees or large limbs downed, by calling the National Weather Service office in Newport at 1-800-889-6889.
